## Stage 1: Horizontal Grid Cells

Registers reusable grid cell definitions that can be referenced in Stage 2a.

> [!NOTE]
> Please ensure you are familiar with the completion guidance in the collapsible dropdown where it exists. Failure to do so will result in a failed submission.

---

### Grid Cell Properties

Define the physical grid structure that can be reused across multiple subgrid registrations in Stage 2a.

label: Grid Type
description: The cell distribution pattern that defines how grid cells are arranged across the domain.

label: Coordinate System
description: The reference coordinate system used for cell positions.

label: Region
description: The geographic coverage area of the grid. **Select multiple.**

label: Temporal Refinement
description: Whether the grid changes over time during the simulation.

label: X Resolution
description: The nominal cell size in the x-direction.

label: Y Resolution
description: The nominal cell size in the y-direction.

label: Units
description: The units used for resolution values.

label: Number of Cells
description: The total number of grid cells in the domain.

label: Southernmost Latitude
description: The southern boundary of the grid in degrees north.

label: Westernmost Longitude
description: The western boundary of the grid in degrees east.

label: Truncation Method
description: The spectral truncation type for spectral grids only.

label: Truncation Number
description: The maximum wavenumber retained for spectral grids only.

label: Additional Collaborators
description: To add attribution to additional members include their GitHub usernames (only) separated by a comma.

---

## Issue Handling

**After submission:**
- Creates `horizontal_grid_cells` (g###)
- Use g### IDs in Stage 2a (Horizontal Computational Grid) to build subgrids
- [Track progress in issue comments](https://github.com/WCRP-CMIP/Essential-Model-Documentation/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3A%40me)

label: Issue Kind
description: Whether this is a new submission or a modification to an existing entry.
